New Records: Ireland set a new best for their highest opening partnership against South Africa in ODI cricket with 101 runs for the first wicket
Fionn Hand took his first ODI wicket on debut
Key Match Events: Paul Stirling scored 88 from 92 deliveries and Harry Tector contributed 60 runs
Ireland's seamers dismissed South Africa for 215 in 46.1 overs
Jason Smith scored 91 runs for South Africa but was dismissed late in the innings
Pre-Game Insights: Paul Stirling called correctly at the toss for the first time in five attempts
Ireland's batting order contributed significantly with multiple players scoring
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling remarked on the team's performance and the importance of the win
Fionn Hand expressed excitement about his debut
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Zayed Cricket Stadium in Abu Dhabi
Ireland ended their international year with a winning performance
